author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Madras High Court on Friday took suo motu cognisance of the death of a 67-year-old differently abled man who took part in a protest in Chennai organised by four organisations working for the rights of disabled persons. The court ordered notice to the State government returnable by March 1.

The First Bench of Chief Justice S.K. Kaul and Justice M.M. Sundresh made the decision following a mention made by R.M.D. Nasrullah, an advocate who is visually impaired. Pointing out media reports, the advocate requested the court to take cognizance of the issue.

On Wednesday morning, police detained the protesters from three different locations in the city and detained them in Rajarathinam stadium. E. Kuppusamy, who was hard of hearing, was among those detained.

At 7 p.m. he fell unconscious and he was rushed to the Government Royapettah Hospital where he died on Thursday.
title: HC notice on death of differently abled man
